WARNINGS.cooldown: This ability has been used during this session already.

immediate.hint: Check if the Effect script must be executed immediately when selected.
immediate.label: Immediate Effect

reverseScript.hint:
This script is executed when an immediate effect is deselected.Arguments:
  - this: The effect being executed.
  - roll: The WFRP3eRoll that is executing the effect script.
  - checkData: Contains various data concerning the check.
  - actor: The WFRP3eActor performing the check.
  - actorToken: The TokenDocument of the WFRP3eActor performing the check.
  - outcome: The sum-up of the changes to be applied to both the actor and the target.
  - targetActor: The WFRP3eActor targetted by the player performing the check.
  - targetActorToken: The TokenDocument targetted by the player performing the check.
reverseScript.label: Reverse Script

script.hint:
This script is executed after an Action check has been validated, if the effect has been selected.
If the effect is immediate, this script is executed when the effect is selected.Arguments:
  - this: The effect being executed.
  - roll: The WFRP3eRoll that is executing the effect script.
  - checkData: Contains various data concerning the check.
  - actor: The WFRP3eActor performing the check.
  - actorToken: The TokenDocument of the WFRP3eActor performing the check.
  - outcome: The sum-up of the changes to be applied to both the actor and the target.
  - targetActor: The WFRP3eActor targetted by the player performing the check.
  - targetActorToken: The TokenDocument targetted by the player performing the check.
script.label: Script

WARNINGS.noActionSelected: You must select an Action card.

WARNINGS.maximumFortuneReached: The Actor cannot have more than {max} fortune points at once.
WARNINGS.minimumSegment: You cannot remove any more segment.

APPLICATION.DESCRIPTION.ActionUsage: Do you really want to use {action}?
APPLICATION.DESCRIPTION.MemberRemoval: Do you really wish to remove {actor} from the party?

DIALOG.cancelAdvance.description: Do you wish to cancel the advance? All the changes it implied will be cancelled.

WARNINGS.dedicationBonusCareerNotCompleted: You cannot buy a career's dedication bonus until it is completed.

chooseAnyCareer.description: You may choose a starting career among every available basic careers.
chooseAnyCareer.title: You Rolled 100

moreThanOneCareer.description: You may choose a starting career among all the available basic careers.
moreThanOneCareer.title: You Have Obtained A Reroll

WARNINGS.noCareerSelectedWarning: You must select a Career sheet.

WARNINGS.notEnoughExperienceForAdvance: You don't have enough Experience to buy this advance.

WARNINGS.convertBack: There is no {type} left to convert back.

unspentCreationPoints.description: You have creation points left to spend. Any unspent creation point will be lost.

WARNINGS.cannotInvestLessThanZero: You cannot invest less than 0 creation points in any category.
WARNINGS.cannotInvestMoreThanFour: You cannot invest more than 4 creation points in any category
WARNINGS.maximumRatingReached: The maximum characteristic rating has been reached.
WARNINGS.minimumRatingReached: The minimum characteristic rating has been reached.

bloodInTheEyes.description: You may place {number} recharge tokens on any combination of {actor}'s action cards.
bloodInTheEyes.title: Blood in the Eyes

choose.description: You must choose which critical wound to inflict between these two: {links}
choose.title: Choose A Critical Wound

lowBlow.description: You may add or remove one recharge token from one of {actor}'s currently recharging cards.
lowBlow.title: Low Blow

deleteEffect.description: Do you really wish to delete the {effect} active effect? This action cannot be undone.
deleteEffect.title: Delete Active Effect

deleteItem.description: Do you really wish to delete the {item} item? This action cannot be undone.
deleteItem.title: Delete Item

delirium.description: Each Delirium symptom counts as 1 stress.
delirium.name: Delirium

fever.description: Each Fever symptom adds ◼ to all mental checks performed by the sufferer.
fever.name: Fever

infectious.description: Each Infectious symptom disables one Party Sheet talent slot. Place a token on the talent slot to show it is unavailable.
infectious.name: Infectious

lethal.description: Each Lethal symptom increases the severity rating of each other disease or symptom card by +1.
lethal.name: Lethal

painful.description: Each Painful symptom adds ◼ to all physical checks performed by the sufferer.
painful.name: Painful

tiring.description: Each Tiring symptom counts as 1 fatigue.
tiring.name: Tiring

virulent.description: Each Virulent symptom acts as a copy of each other symptom the target suffers from.
virulent.name: Virulent

weary.description: Each Weary symptom adds 1 recharge token to actions performed, or adds 1 fewer token to Ongoing actions.
weary.name: Weary

priority.hint: The higher the value, the sooner the script will be executed compared to the lower values.
priority.label: Priority

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed whenever an Action is used, either after a check roll or a simple activation.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Item} action: The Action that has been used.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that used the Action.
	- {string} face: Which face of the Action card was used, either "conservative" or "reckless".
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed each time an Actor is being prepared.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor being prepared.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed each time the related Item is socketed onto a Career.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time the Actor transitions from a Career to another.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that is transitioning careers.
	- {Career} previousCareer: The previous Career.
	- {Career} nextCareer: The new current career.
	- {number} cost: The current cost of the transition.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed during a check outcome calculation.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that performed the check.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {CheckRoll} checkRoll: The concerned Check Roll which outcome is being calculated.
	- {CheckOutcome} outcome: The sum-up of the changes to be applied to both the actor and the target.
	- {Actor} target: The Actor targeted by the check.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time a check is being prepared or re-prepared.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor preparing the check.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {DiePool} diePool: The current die pool of the check.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed at the creation of a Check Roll.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that is performing the check.
	- {ChatMessage} chatMessage: The Chat Message containing the Check Roll.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {CheckRoll} checkRoll: The concerned Check Roll.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed before Creation Point Investment starts during Character Generation.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {number} options.startingCreationPoints: The total number of creation points to spend.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time damages are inflicted to the Actor.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor suffering wounds.
	- {number} damages: The currently calculated amount of damages.
	- {number} soak: The currently calculated soak value.
	- {Item} weapon: The weapon used to inflict damages.
	- {number} wounds: The Actor's current number of wounds.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time one or several new item(s) are either added to an Actor or directly created for him/her.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor receiving new item(s).
	- {Array} items: The new item(s).
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time the Actor's fatigue is adjusted from outside the Actor's sheet.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor whose fatigue is being adjusted.
	- {number} fatigue: The current fatigue of the Actor.
	- {number} value: The currently calculated adjustment value for the fatigue.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time the fortune of the Actor's party refreshes.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor whose party has its fortune refreshing.
	- {number} party: The party which fortune is refreshing.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed whenever the item owning this Active Effect is added to an Actor.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor receiving the item.
	- {Item} item: The added item.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed on the User action only.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor owning the triggered item.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

conditionalScript.hint:
This script verifies that this Active Effect can be triggered depending on the check context.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect which macro is being tested.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that performed the check.
	- {ChatMessage} chatMessage: The Chat Message containing the Check Roll.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {CheckRoll} checkRoll: The concerned Check Roll.
	Return value: Must be a boolean, true if conditions are met, false otherwise.
conditionalScript.label: Conditional Script

script.hint:
This script is executed whenever the Item is triggered in order to perform changes to a rolled check.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that performed the check.
	- {ChatMessage} chatMessage: The Chat Message containing the Check Roll.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {CheckRoll} checkRoll: The concerned Check Roll.
script.label: Script

conditionalScript.hint:
This script verifies that this Active Effect can be triggered depending on the check context.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect which macro is being tested.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor preparing the check.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {DiePool} diePool: The current die pool of the check.
	Return value: Must be a boolean, true if conditions are met, false otherwise.
conditionalScript.label: Conditional Script

postRollScript.hint:
This script is executed once the check has been rolled in order to perform follow-up operations on the related Item.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that performed the check.
	- {DiePool} diePool: The die pool of the rolled check.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {CheckRoll} checkRoll: The resulting check roll.
postRollScript.label: Post-Roll Script

script.hint:
This script is executed every time a check is being prepared or re-prepared if selected.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor preparing the check.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {DiePool} diePool: The current die pool of the check.
script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time the Actor's power or favour is adjusted from outside the Actor's sheet.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor whose power or favour is being adjusted.
	- {number} current: The Actor's current amount of power/favour.
	- {"favour"|"power"} type: Which value is being adjusted between power and favour.
	- {number} value: The currently calculated adjustment value for the power or favour.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script verifies whether the Item can be acquired during Character Generation or as part of Career Advances.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor that may (or may not) acquire the Item.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time the Actor's stance is adjusted.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor whose stance is being adjusted.
	- {number} current: The current stance of the Actor.
	- {number} value: The new stance value of the Actor.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed before Starting Skill Training Selection starts during Character Generation.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Array} options.freeAcquisitions: The UUIDs of the skills acquired for free.
	- {Array} options.freeTrainings: The UUIDs of the skills trained for free.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed before Starting Talent Selection starts during Character Generation.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Array} options.freeItemTypes: The various types of Item currently available to select one copy of during Starting Talent Selection.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time the Actor's stress is adjusted from outside the Actor's sheet.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor whose stress is being adjusted.
	- {number} stress: The current stress of the Actor.
	- {number} value: The currently calculated adjustment value for the stress.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time a check targeting another Actor is being prepared or re-prepared.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor targeted by the check.
	- {CheckData} checkData: Various data related to the check.
	- {DiePool} diePool: The current die pool of the check.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

FIELDS.script.hint:
This script is executed every time the Actor's wounds are adjusted from outside the Actor's sheet.
Arguments:
	- {ActiveEffect} this: The Active Effect owning this macro.
	- {Actor} actor: The Actor whose wounds are being adjusted.
	- {number} stress: The Actor's current number of wounds.
	- {number} value: The currently calculated adjustment value for the wounds.
FIELDS.script.label: Script

adventure.label: Why Did You Become an Adventurer?
adventure.hint: An adventurer’s life is dangerous. So what was it that made you choose this life of peril? Are you on a personal or political crusade? Are you out to get vengeance on those who ruined or murdered your family? Are you a thrill seeker or gold chaser?

family.label: What is Your Family Like?
family.hint: Are you an only child or do you have brothers and sisters? What’s your place in the family? Are you parents still alive? If not, how did they die?

friendsFoes.label: Who are Your Friends and Enemies?
friendsFoes.hint: The other player characters may well be your best friends, but this isn’t necessarily the case. You may not even know each other when play begins. So what friends do you have and where do they live? Are you on good terms or have you had a falling out? Similarly, do you have any enemies? If so, how did it happen? Friends can help you out in a pinch or turn into your most bitter enemies. GMs looking to make an adventure more meaningful can involve your character's personal enemies.

loveHate.label: Who do You Love/Hate?
loveHate.hint: Love and hate are the strongest of emotions. What place do they have in your life? Are you in love with someone? On the flipside, who do you hate and why? Vengeance is a strong motivation and often linked to hatred. You may hate individuals (such as your enemies) or whole classes of people or creatures. If your wife was slain by Beastmen, for example, you might hate them above all other foes. Perhaps an unscrupulous bailiff caused your family to lose its home and now you are convinced that all nobles are crooks and scoundrels.

loyalty.label: Who are You Loyal to?
loyalty.hint: Real loners are rare in the Old World. It is too dangerous a place to get by without allies. Are there any people or organizations that you are loyal to? Your career might suggest an answer to this question, such as the Colleges of Magic or the Cult of Sigmar, but you might just as easily be loyal to an important person from your past.

origin.label: Where are You From?
origin.hint: This is the most fundamental question for your character. Are you from a big city, like Altdorf, or a tiny farming hamlet? If you're a dwarf, are you karak-born, or from an outlying community or hold?

past.label: What Did You Do Before You Became an Adventurer?
past.hint: This is an important question. Your career provides a basic answer, but you refine this further. Try to figure out exactly what you did before you became an adventurer. The details you’ve already worked out and the skills you chose during character creation can help you make some decisions.

piety.label: How Religious are You?
piety.hint: Some folk are more pious than others. Are you particularly religious? If so, is there a God you favour? Are you constantly seeking answers or at peace with your faith? Initiates and Priests, of course, must make this decision early on.

possessions.label: What are Your Prized Possessions?
possessions.hint: Do you have any items of sentimental value? These need not be items of monetary value, but they should have special meaning for you. Is the rusty sword you wield the only thing your father ever gave you? Is the copper ring you wear a remembrance of your slain husband? You might also discuss with the GM important things that you’ve already lost and would do anything to get back.

socialClass.label: What is Your Social Class?
socialClass.hint: Some careers, such as Commoner and Burgher, have an implied social class. Others can work with a variety of social classes. Where in the social strata does your family fall? Have you moved up, socially, or fallen from grace?

WARNINGS.incompleteAnswers.description: You have not answered every questions.
WARNINGS.incompleteAnswers.title: Incomplete Answers

GAMEOFTENQUESTIONS.description: If you need some help fleshing out your character, try answering these ten questions. They should allow you to focus your thoughts on your emerging alter ego.
GAMEOFTENQUESTIONS.title: Game of Ten Questions

athelLoren.introduction: To reflect their ties to nature and tradition-bound culture, wood elf characters have the following racial abilities:
athelLoren.name: Wood Elf of Athel Loren

karakAzgaraz.introduction: To reflect their fierce spirit and proud traditions, Karak Azgaraz dwarf characters have the following racial abilities:
karakAzgaraz.name: Dwarf of Karak Azgaraz

reiklander.introduction: To reflect their upbringing and individuality, Reiklander characters have the following racial abilities:
reiklander.name: Reiklander

ulthuan.introduction: To reflect their cultured upbringing and rich history, high elf characters have the following racial abilities:
ulthuan.name: High Elf of Ulthuan

SELECTOR.proceedDialog: Would you still like to proceed?

startingCareerDrawingMethod.name: Starting Career Drawing Method
startingCareerDrawingMethod.hint:
Defines the way a new character's starting career is drawn with the Character Generator.
– Draw Three: Three basic careers are drawn amongst those existing within the world and its compendium.
– Roll Table: One single basic career is drawn from the Starting Career Table.
– Free Choice: The starting career can be chosen amongst every available basic career within the world and its compendium.
